 For the CSS, let's start a new layer called cover -- move the cover styles from audio to cover.

 - border should always be on for .cover img so remove MQ.

 - We only see one SVG icon - let's set these up with a fill color and a hover state.

   .icons svg {
    fill: var(--lime);
  }
  .icons svg:hover {
    fill: var(--cyan);
  } 

  - Our icons will be in a column on mobile and in a row on desktop. Flexbox or grid?... Flexbox is pretty easy.

    .icons ul {
    list-style-type: none;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 1rem 0;
    display: flex;
    flex-flow: column wrap;
    justify-content: center;
    align-items: center;
    gap: 2rem;
  }

  - Now we need ot get the icons on top of the cover image. We could do this with positioning, or... we can do it with Grid, much more easily and without having to mess around with positioning which we'll need later.

  Our grid will have 3 rows and 1 column. The cover image, icons, and audio player each occupy a row.
    .cover > * {
    border: 1px solid white;
  }

  .cover {
    display: grid;
    grid-template-rows: repeat (3, auto); 
  }

  Tell each row where to display.

  .cover img {
    border: 2px solid var(--cyan);
    grid-column: 1/2;
    grid-row: 1/3;
  }
  .icons {
    grid-row: 1/3;
    grid-column: 1/2;
    }

  #audio-player-container {
    grid-row: 3/4;
    grid-column: 1/2;
  }

  Finalize icon styling.

    .icons {
    justify-self: end;
    padding-right: 1rem;
  }

  Now how do we get it in place for the desktop version? 800 px and up

 @media (min-width: 800px) {
   .icons {
    margin-top: -2rem;
  }
  .icons ul {
    flex-flow: row wrap;
  }
  }
